resources.string:
D&D Playable Races

Human: Versatile and adaptable, humans gain +1 to all ability scores.

Elf: Graceful and long-lived, elves have keen senses and a natural affinity for magic. +2 Dexterity.

Dwarf: Hardy and resilient, dwarves are known for their craftsmanship and combat prowess. +2 Constitution.

Halfling: Small and nimble, halflings are naturally lucky and brave. +2 Dexterity.

Dragonborn: Proud dragon-like humanoids with breath weapons. +2 Strength, +1 Charisma.

Gnome: Small, intelligent, and curious inventors. +2 Intelligence.

Half-Elf: Combining human versatility with elven grace. +2 Charisma, +1 to two other abilities.

Half-Orc: Strong and tough with orcish heritage. +2 Strength, +1 Constitution.

Tiefling: Infernal heritage grants them resistance to fire and innate spellcasting. +2 Charisma, +1 Intelligence.

D&D Playable Classes

Barbarian: Fierce warriors who channel rage in combat. High HP and damage output.

Bard: Charismatic performers who use music and magic to inspire allies and confound foes.

Cleric: Divine spellcasters who serve deities and can heal or harm.

Druid: Nature-focused spellcasters who can shapeshift into animals.

Fighter: Master of martial combat with proficiency in all weapons and armor.

Monk: Martial artists who harness ki energy for supernatural abilities.

Paladin: Holy warriors who combine combat prowess with divine magic.

Ranger: Wilderness experts skilled in tracking, survival, and combat.

Rogue: Stealthy specialists in stealth, deception, and precision strikes.

Sorcerer: Innate spellcasters whose magic comes from their bloodline.

Warlock: Gain magical powers through a pact with an otherworldly patron.

Wizard: Scholarly spellcasters who learn magic through study and practice.
